resources.string: Tarzan\'s Obstacle Park consists of 5 tracks and 76 different obstacles placed in trees up to 15 meters above the ground. It will be interesting for both children and adults, since the tracks are tailored to different interests.

Offers guided tours in Karosta Prison and museum, show "Behind Bars", accommodation and Extreme Night in prison. Different activities in Northern Forts like guided tour, Spy game Escape from USSR and Labyrinth of Senses.
Every Sunday from June 1st till September 1st at midday 12:00 leisure activities, puppet theatre or cirkus performances for children.
There are up to 20 different 3D animal targets in the 3D archery range, which are placed so that anyone would be able to shoot.
Recreation on the water - windsurfing, kite-surfing, water-skiing, bladders, water-motorbikes, motorboats. Rentals and lessons. Portable kitchen, sauna, tent places.
In summer, "BB wakepark" has the variety of offers as wakeboarding track and equipment rentals, SUP board and boats rental, and for the full relaxation, sauna and hot-tub services.
Furious and comfortable boat rental for trips in Liepāja Trade Canal and Lake, as well as in rivers of Kurzeme.

Quest House – is a unique adventure – offers you an interesting team game for groups of 2-4 people. You get locked in a room, in order to escape you should examine all hides, using hints and clues solve all riddles, applying your logics and savvy.
Ship Četri vēji and catamaran rent
Boat trips in Liepāja port area and the sea. Boarding at the yacht port in Liepāja promenade. Fishing in the sea and long boat trips.

A lagoon-type lake that was formed with the retreat of the Baltic Sea. An important waterfowl nesting and transit place during migration periods. During the nesting period many bird species that are threatened in Europe find their shelter here. The lake and its surrounding meadows are a nature reserve area. There are two bird watching towers one the lake.

The beach is 50 to 80 m wide when the wind is calm, and it has white fine sand which amazes even those who have been to the world\'s most famous beach resorts. After a strong wind you can find some pieces of amber washed ashore. \n Liepāja has a first beach in Latvia, adjusted for people with special needs.

Liepaja is very proud of the park. It was developed at the end of the 19th century. The park is 3 km long with a total area of 70 ha and is one of the largest planted parks in Latvia. It is the home of Latvias largest drums, nouveau fountain, The Swan Pond, Monument for sailors and fishermen lost at sea, children playground and much more.
This is a landscape park, developed at the 19th century. Also has a children playground
When having a walk on the beach, supplement it with a sightseeing on the Sauthern Breakwater for even nicer memories.
1800 meters long, this breakwater is a famous place for the locals to enjoy the beaty of nature during storms.
The Seaside Velo-track is a beautiful place in Liepaja for bike rides and strolls. You\'ll wish you could take the pine and sea smell with you!

The new concert hall Great Amber is a regional centre of culture and events, home to the Liepaja Symphony Orchestra, Liepaja Music, Art and Design High School, as well as the concert hall’s manager and event producer - LLC Great Amber. Its acoustics have been created by world leaders in their fields – Prof. Karlheinz Müller of Müller BBM, Germany, and Prof. Christian Bartenbach of Bartenbach, Germany, respectively.

The Latvian Musicians Alley of Fame was opened in 2006, with its 40 bronze plaques each with handprints of musicians, 12 plaques honoring current and former music bands, and 5 plaques dedicated to musicians who are not with us any more.

The heart of Liepāja is its Rose Square, located in the heart of the city centre. In 1910, city authorities decided to construct a public rosegarden. Hence, in 1911 the square was given the name Rose Square, its name to this day. The coats of arms of Liepāja\'s sister cities are placed on the edging around the bed of roses.

The song is frozen in bronze and yet it can be heard. Everyone walking towards the sea along Kūrmājas prospekts will be followed by a gaze of curious crow, a boatman known also as a coffin-maker, a telephone technician climbed on a pole, and a crouching forest of people… “Pilsētā, kurā piedzimst vējš…” (City where the wind is born) is a song of particular importance for the residents of Liepāja.

In Applied Arts Centre you can meet the masters of Applied Arts Studio "Kursa", "Liepava" and "Zītars" which manage our immaterial cultural heritage. Weavers, knitters and amber jewelery makers demonstrate their skills and organize workshops to teach applied arts skills.

The House of Craftsmen offers to view and try out the wide variety of Latvian traditional crafts – amber processing, weaving, minting of coins, making jewellery and pottery, as well as to watch the making of modern pieces of art such as silk painting, tapestry, felting, etc. The exhibition of the House of Craftsmen displays the national costumes of Lejaskurzeme counties, some of which are more than a century old, Latvian longest amber string of beads, artworks of local craftsmen and ancient tools used by our ancestors – craftsmen.

The Peter Market is located on Kurshu square (Kuršu laukums) and still is the largest market in the city. The pavilion of the market was opened in 1910. It was designed by the architect Melvil. The pavilion had an innovative shape for those times.
Museum Liepāja during the Occupation Regimes

Permanent display tells about social, political, economic and cultural life in Liepāja and its region during German and Soviet occupation in 1939-1991 and how the freedom of Latvia was regained in 1991. The house also hosts Jānis Lādītis’s photo collection exposition. Themed exhibitions of the museum’s collection and art displays are also organized here.

The Liepāja Museum resides in one of the most beautiful 20th century buildings in Liepāja. The museum exhibition tells the history of the Liepāja City and its surrounding area from the Stone Age to the early 20th century. The museum also has on display an exposition dedicated to a wood carver Miķelis Pankoks (1894-1983) and two exhibition halls.

The award-winning hotel restaurant Piano offers gourmet cuisine using organic products and its specialties: home-made fresh bread and ice cream. For an instant cultural experience you may enjoy exhibitions in the hotel art gallery Promenade, or watch the bright white sails go by during summer yacht regattas hosted by Liepaja Yacht Center right in front of the hotel.

House Of Food is a place to eat good, quick international food from all corners of the world (please view the full menu below). Louie Fontaine, the owner and rock musician, has designed the place with a feel similar to a 50’s American diner, with an open kitchen and restaurant booths so high you’ll sit cosy and private in your own restaurant.

The restaurant Libava is located in an exclusive place on the bank of the Liepāja Trade Canal in Recreational Centre “Libava” building. The restaurant Libava offers excellent cuisine with a vast selection of fish dishes and exquisite meat dishes, business lunch every weekday, menu selected according to your needs for events organised at the recreational centre.
One of the best restaurants in the city, located in Europa City Amrita Hotel

The restaurant is known for it\'s international cuisine and friendly service. Every customer that comes through the restaurant door is either a friend or will become one. Either its a quick lunch in the middle of your day, or a leisure evening with your friends while drinking wine - "Upe" will always guarantee the appropriate atmosphere and service.

This restaurant - separated from passing trams, cars and the hustle of pedestrians by a transparent glass wall - is located in the heart of Liepāja. The glass creates the feeling that the days hustle and reality is somehow remote and unreal, allowing guests to enjoy their break while sitting in the summer garden or calmly peering out through the windows.

Restaurant "Olive" offers a various choice of menu from cold snack and salads, meat and fish courses, pastas, pizzas, and also a variety of sushi. Kids menu is available as well. Open type kitchen gives you theclose insight into the process of cooking and the professional work of our chefs’ team.

This old port warehouse stores the memories of a 200 years long history and you may find a glimpse of it in every of the 50 guest rooms. The individual design of each room will preserve the magic of discovering something new every time you visit Promenade Hotel! Enjoy a sauna in the room, soft bathrobe and slippers or celebrate special moments at the marvelous banquet rooms!

The hotel design is out of this world, full of royal furniture, all gold plated standing in contrast with the old factory spirit, you will feel like a king staying at the Fontaine Royal. The hotel has a music club in an old warehouse, (Fontaine Palace, capacity 600 people), offering live bands from around the globe.

The recreational centre Libava offers its guests seven hotel rooms equipped with modern amenities. Each room has a different design and interior. Guests also have the opportunity to enjoy a leisurely breakfast and romantic candlelight dinner in the winter garden with palm-trees and a fountain.

You\'ll find here 83 comfortable rooms designed in a cosy Scandinavian style. Hotel offers a choice of room types from single accommodation to luxury two room suites with steam saunas. Presidential suites located on two floors will surprise you with panoramic view over the town. 8 rooms are specially equipped for wheel chair users.

The hotel offers 115 guest rooms of different categories, a restaurant, bar and conference hall, as well as a parking lot under security surveillance. To preserve the competitiveness and meet best standards of hospitality renovation works are carried out on regular basis.

The guesthouse Roze is a little star on the shore of the Baltic Sea. The atmosphere of Jugendstil has been created in the antique detached house. Furniture, pictures, restaurant-bar, tea room and winter garden - everything holds the atmosphere of the time and style of the beginning of the 20th century.

The Hotel is located on a small cobblestone street, towards the canal, 500 m from the beach, with a nice backyard. Hotel can accommodate 44 people in 18 different rooms. Each room has its own design and charm, a true adventure. Guests can oder breakfast.

There are 3 floors with 10 rooms. All rooms are large, bright and cosy with obsolete, old, and at the same time, modern atmosphere. Mansard floor has 2 minilux rooms with nice view to the old city. There are preserved old wooden beams and other antique elements on the mansard floor.

Ezera Maja is situated on the street that connects the Baltic sea and Liepaja\'s lake.This 100 year old house has been completely renovated and offers you all of the comforts. At the same time we have kept its old, homely, Latvian spirit. You will be enchanted by the decor of each of the rooms in Ezera Maja. Even the tiniest detail has been made with the special love of an artist’s hand. The rooms are equipped using natural local materials, keeping the ancient feel of the house.
